definition: expanse of water/ooze/(onom.) bark/classifier for liquids: pool, puddle
expanse of water/ooze/(onom.) bark/classifier for liquids: pool, puddle

sentences.english: Her long, narrow blue eyes were swimming.
sentences.chinese: 她那双细长的蓝眼睛泪汪汪的。
她只是感觉老是泪汪汪地想哭。

sentences.english: Michael looked at him imploringly, eyes brimming with tears.
sentences.chinese: 迈克尔满怀乞求地看着他，两眼泪汪汪的。

sentences.english: Her little mouth puckered up and tears filled her eyes.
Mary's eyes were drowned in tears.
The patient was dewey-eyed when he knew his condition.
sentences.chinese: 当那病人知道自己的病情时，眼泪汪汪。

sentences.english: I nearly fear to tear the tearful girl's test IT.
sentences.chinese: 我几乎畏惧撕谁人两泪汪汪的女孩的试卷。

sentences.english: Her eyes were moist, her voice was jagged with excitement .
sentences.chinese: 她眼睛泪汪汪的，声调由于兴奋而变得急促。

sentences.english: When the little girl saw the dead bird she dissolved into tears.
sentences.chinese: 当小女孩看到那只死鸟时，她哭得眼泪汪汪的。

sentences.english: Five children playing Monopoly always ended in tears.
sentences.chinese: 五个玩棋牌游戏的孩子总是以眼泪汪汪告终的。

sentences.english: My friends scorn me: but mine eye poureth out tears unto God.
sentences.chinese: 我的朋友讥诮我，我却向神眼泪汪汪。

sentences.english: Her eyes were moist and her voice was jagged with excitement.
sentences.chinese: 她眼睛泪汪汪的，声调由于兴奋而变得急促。

sentences.english: My only daughter, Sindu, looked frightened. Tears were welling up in her eyes.
sentences.chinese: 我的独生女儿信德一脸惊恐，眼泪汪汪。

sentences.english: Her eyes became watery because of the smoke.
sentences.chinese: 因为烟熏，她的双眼变得泪汪汪的。

sentences.english: He hadn't noticed the moisture in her eyes or even her departure.
sentences.chinese: 他没有注意到她两眼泪汪汪，甚至连她走了都不知道。

definition: gleaming with tears/woof woof (sound of a dog barking)/(literary) (of a body of water) broad and deep
to weep disconsolately/to cry on each other's shoulder
tears and mucus flowing profusely/sniveling/in a tragic state
lit. like raindrops on a pear blossom (idiom)/fig. tear-stained face of a beauty
